facts: Many big news stories spread on social media in minutes, which is much faster than newspapers could ever travel.
Fact-checkers compare claims with reliable evidence like official records, expert interviews, and original photos or videos.
Elections are current events because leaders chosen by voters can change laws, schools, and how money is spent on public services.
Climate and weather news often mentions carbon dioxide because it is a heat-trapping gas that can warm the planet when it builds up in the air.
Scientists track new diseases by testing samples and sharing data so health officials can spot outbreaks early.
Space missions are current events too, and modern probes use radios to send scientific data across millions of kilometers back to Earth.
